title: Miles Okazaki - Trickster (2017)
description: Pi Recordings: Pi68 http://www.pirecordings.com/album/pi68 * Miles Okazaki: guitar * Craig Taborn : piano * Anthony Tidd : bass * Sean Rickman : drums http://www.milesokazaki.com/ http://www.craigtaborn.com/ http://www.allmusic.com/artist/anthony-tidd-mn0000924839 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sean_Rickman Recorded by Joe Marciano and Max Ross at Systems Two Recording Studios, Brooklyn, New York, USA, on January 14-15, 2016. Reviews ~~~~~~~ By Craig Premo Trickster is an apt name, as what at first seems like a quiet, unassuming recording turns into an unexpected delight with further investigation. Okazaki has accomplished a difficult feat: Making a record that is both adventurous and accessible. Okazaki and his group take Steve Coleman’s M-Base concepts and apply their own interpretation, one which encompasses complex rhythms married to compositions with attractive melodies, even hints of the blues and boogie-woogie. Okazaki has a quiet style that fits the music perfectly, and Craig Taborn does his usual fantastic job of fitting into a group concept and bringing his point of view. Tidd and Rickman are less well known to me, but provide sure-handed support in support of the mood of each piece. Miles Okazaki has taken a huge leap forward in his evolution as an artist with Trickster. -- By Hrayr Attarian http://www.allaboutjazz.com/trickster-miles-okazaki-pi-recordings-review-by-hrayr-attarian.php By Raul da Gama http://jazzdagama.com/music/miles-okazaki-trickster/ By Will Layman http://www.popmatters.com/review/miles-okazaki-trickster/ By Tim Niland Da Nicola Negri (it) http://www.allaboutjazz.com/trickster-miles-okazaki-pi-recordings-review-by-nicola-negri.php Por Sergio Piccirilli (es) http://elintruso.com/2017/03/24/miles-okazaki-trickster/
